oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Purple Heart
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photographs from four different angles of Purple Heart medal awarded to John Sales for wounds sustained during his service in Vietnam. Sales was wounded twice in Vietnam--once in February 1967 by a sniper as he was crossing a rice paddy; secondly, in an April 10 night ambush by Viet Cong as his patrol was encamped along a trail.

John L. Sales of Nashville, Tenn. (b. April 7, 1947) served in the United States Marine Corps from May 1966 to May 1968. A member of Co. A, 1st Battalion, 4th Rgt., 3rd Marine Division, he saw action in the northern sector of South Vietnam from December 1966 to June 1967. Wounded twice in combat, Pvt. Sales received the Purple Heart medal.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: John L. Sales, 1947-
